body_html: Well, indeed! The issue is when the number of entries of of U2_r depends on a parameter that I'll put in the constructor. In this case, I can't do for n ... self.U2_r[n]. I'll have to go through something like self.buffers['U2_r%i' % n] which I found not really pretty!
body_text: Well, indeed! The issue is when the number of entries of of U2_r depends on a parameter that I'll put in the constructor. In this case, I can't do for n ... self.U2_r[n]. I'll have to go through something like self.buffers['U2_r%i' % n] which I found not really pretty!
body: Well, indeed! The issue is when the number of entries of of U2_r depends on a parameter that I'll put in the constructor. In this case, I can't do for n ... self.U2_r[n]. I'll have to go through something like self._buffers['U2_r_%i' % n] which I found not really pretty!
